question.para: I'd like to get more detailled logging information on what methods are called inside JpaRepository, e.g. How can I gain them?

answer.para: You can make use of CustomizableTraceInterceptor provided by Spring:
answer.programlisting:
<bean id="customizableTraceInterceptor" class=" org.springframework.aop.interceptor.CustomizableTraceInterceptor"> <property name="enterMessage" value="Entering $[methodName]($[arguments])"/> <property name="exitMessage" value="Leaving $[methodName](): $[returnValue]"/> </bean>
<aop:config> <aop:advisor advice-ref="customizableTraceInterceptor" pointcut="execution(public * org.sfw.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository+.*(..))"/> </aop:config>

question.para: I want to use Spring Data JPA auditing capabilities but have my database already set up to set modification and creation date on entities. How to prevent Hades to set the date programmatically.

answer.para: Just use the set-dates attribute of the auditing namespace element to false.
